txt.en: Thorgest's brother Thorkell was killed a few days earlier by worms.

'Ah, thank you for the help, [placeholder]. I will recover in time from these wounds, but nothing can help my brother, Thorkell. When last I saw him he was trapped in the jaws of a great worm. I can only hope his end was swift.

'The worms will have left naught to bury, but they do not eat dwarf-steel. If you dare venture within their caves and retrieve what remains of my brother's belongings, I shall reward you richly.

'You can find the worm caves to the south-east.'
The worm caves are to the south-east of Thorgest's dwelling.\n\nThorgest has asked you to find and return Thorkell's belongings.

'Ah, is this all that remains of my fair brother Thorkell? Would that I had fallen in his stead....

'But nay, I speak as a fool in my mourning! My dear brother was ever the warrior and adventurer -- moreso than I. He gave his life as he chose to save mine, and I'll never again gainsay his valour for doing so. Nor will I dishonour his name by failing to live as he chose that I should.

'It seems that I have much to do, [placeholder], and wallowing in my grief while the merciless wind wears down these mountains will not get it done!'
Return Thorkell's effects to his brother Thorgest at his abode in the Misty Mountains.
'Have the worms devoured everything? Something must remain of my brother's belongings that you can recover....'
